She received antibiotics for aspiration pneumonia, and underwent PEG tube placement. ACUTE ISSUES: # Aspiration pneumonia Patient presented from rehab with fevers, leukocytosis, and cough in the setting of re-starting a pureed diet. CXR showed RLL consolidation. She was initially treated with vancomycin, ceftazidime, and Flagyl x1 dose (), de-escalated to Unasyn (), and then transitioned to Augmentin 875mg Q12H (start , END DATE with plan to complete a 7-day course. Her WBC count on admission was 26 and subsequently downtrended. She remained stable and satting well on room air throughout the entire hospitalization. Organism was not able to be isolated, strep/legionella ag were negative. # Acute on chronic dysphagia radiation from throat cancer Patient with chronic mild dysphagia at baseline due to prior throat cancer s/p radiation treatment. She became acutely decompensated during previous hospitalization, was placed and she was discharged on TFs, NPO. She was then re-started on pureed diet, with subsequent likely aspiration pneumonia. During last hospitalization PEG tube was discussed, but patient refused at that time. In light of current events, however, she agreed to pursue PEG tube, which was placed by on . tube was removed on day of discharge. # Anemia Baseline Hb likely . During last hospitalization she had acute drop to 6.9, likely blood loss with hematoma formation at surgical site. Discharge Hb at that time was 8.1, and admission Hb 7.3 now, likely multifactorial but there was no evidence of bleeding. Her Hb downtrended to 7.0 and she received 1U pRBCs with appropriate bump. Work-up showed inappropriately normal retic, no evidence of hemolysis, iron studies consistent with AoCD with possible component of iron deficiency anemia (Tsat 5%). CHRONIC ISSUES: # Left femoral neck fracture Patient had fall on . S/p surgical fixation. Seen by Ortho during this hospital stay, staples removed. # Atrial Fibrillation # Bradycardia The patient developed new atrial fibrillation during last hospitalization iso post-op. She was able to be converted back to sinus and then remained bradycardic. She was discharged on diltiazem and apixaban. Given persistent bradycardia to during this admission, decision was made to discontinue diltiazem. Her Apixaban 5mg BID was continued.
